newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada exports 1.4 mln T wheat, barley to US 96/97.
newsitem.headline: Canada exports 1.4 mln T wheat, barley to US 96/97.

text.p: Canada exported 1,400,100 tonnes of wheat, durum wheat and barley to the United States between August 1, 1996, and April 17, 1997, Canadian Grain Commission statistics show.

Canadian grain shipments to the U.S. through the Canadian Wheat Board and unsanctioned and unlicensed truck shipments by Canadian farmers opposed to the CWB's export monopoly have led to rising tension with border U.S. states.
North Dakota farmers recently asked U.S. Trade Representative Charlene Barshevsky to reinstate a cap on Canadian grain imports into the U.S. at 1.5 million tonnes.

The head of U.S. Department of Agriculture's Foreign Agriculture Service told a U.S. House Agriculture subcommittee earlier Thursday Canada said it "would try not to exceed" 1.4 to 1.5 million tonnes of wheat and barley exports to the U.S.
A spokesman for Canadian Agriculture Minister Ralph Goodale said Canada had "no interest at all" in limiting wheat exports.
The Canadian Wheat Board declined comment on export levels.
Canada shipped 793,100 tonnes of wheat to date in the current crop year, up 93 percent from the same period in the prior crop year when 410,100 tonnes of wheat entered the U.S., CGC statistics show.

The balance of the 1,400,100 tonnes of grain came in the form of durum wheat shipments at 179,500, up 122 percent from 80,700 tonnes in the previous marketing period, and 427,500 tonnes of barley, up 12 percent from 381,400 tonnes in the prior period, CGC figures show.
Canada agreed in 1994 to cap exports of wheat and durum wheat, but not barley, to the U.S. at 1.5 million tonnes.
Extensive flooding of the Mississippi River that year cut U.S. output and led to the higher-than-usual Canadian shipments.
The deal ended Sept 12, 1995, to comply with new World Trade Organization and North American Free Trade Agreement rules.
The CWB exported an annual average of 972,000 tonnes of wheat and durum to the United States between August 1, 1986 and July 31, 1996, the CWB's annual report shows.
The CWB exported an annual average of 575,000 tonnes of barley to the U.S. in the same 10-year period.
